summary: This is the FBI Daily News Briefing for July 24, 2023, covering a wide range of national and international news items. It includes a section on criminal investigations where it is noted that Leon Black settled Epstein-related claims and that Epstein victims plan to sue the FBI. The briefing also covers other FBI news, counterintelligence, and various criminal cases.

persons.name: Leon Black
persons.context: Agreed to pay $62.5 million to the U.S. Virgin Islands to settle potential claims arising from the territory's investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's sex trafficking operation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to the U.S. Virgin Islands investigation and the settlement with Leon Black. His estate previously settled with the Virgin Islands for $105 million.

persons.name: Maria Farmer
persons.context: One of two victims who filed a notice of claim indicating they plan to sue the FBI for $600 million for allegedly failing to investigate Epstein in the 1990s.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned as being flagged to authorities along with Epstein by Maria Farmer in 1996.

persons.name: Christopher Wray
persons.context: Mentioned in multiple news items: defended FISA Section 702, discussed China's threat, and was questioned about an FBI memo targeting traditionalist Catholics. Public confidence in the FBI under his leadership is discussed.

connections.description: Black paid a settlement to the U.S. Virgin Islands to be released from potential claims related to the Epstein investigation.
Maxwell is described as Epstein's accomplice in the sex trafficking operation.
Farmer is a victim of Epstein and is leading a planned lawsuit against the FBI for failing to investigate him.

events.title: Leon Black Settlement with U.S. Virgin Islands
events.description: Billionaire Leon Black agreed to pay $62.5 million to the U.S. Virgin Islands to settle potential claims from its investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's sex trafficking operation.

events.title: Notice of Claim Filed Against FBI by Epstein Victims
events.description: Attorney for Maria Farmer and another victim filed a notice of claim, a prelude to a $600 million class-action lawsuit against the FBI for allegedly failing to investigate Epstein in the 1990s.

events.title: FBI Daily News Briefing Published
events.description: The FBI's Office of Public Affairs distributed its daily news briefing, summarizing major news stories including items related to the Epstein case and other FBI activities.

keyFacts: Leon Black agreed in January 2023 to pay $62.5 million to the U.S. Virgin Islands to settle potential claims from the territory's Epstein investigation.
Epstein victims, including Maria Farmer, plan to file a $600 million lawsuit against the FBI for failing to investigate Epstein in the 1990s after being alerted.
The U.S. Virgin Islands had previously reached a $105 million settlement with Jeffrey Epstein's estate in November.
The document is an FBI Daily News Briefing, indicating the information is being circulated within or by the FBI's public affairs office.
The briefing covers numerous other news stories unrelated to Epstein, indicating the Epstein items are part of a broader news summary.
